name: Access to Excellence Bursary Fund
description: To be awarded to students enrolled in the Undergraduate Medical Education program at the Faculty of Medicine on the basis of financial need. Financial aid applications will be available in August.

name: A. H. Walkley Bursary Fund
description: To be awarded to students in need of financial assistance. Preference will be given to students registered in the Millie Rotman Shime Academic Bridging Program or another Woodsworth College Access program.

name: Allan Marshall Memorial Bursary
description: Awarded in memory of Flt/Lt. S.A. Marshall (UC 1948) who gave his life in the service of Canada on May 19, 1956. The bursary of the value of the annual income is awarded to a University College student entering their graduating year, requiring financial assistance, who has in previous years obtained high academic standing and has been active in student affairs.

name: Alta Lind Cook Prize
description: Awarded to a Victoria College student or former student who has graduated within one year for the best original musical composition or the best original literary composition in either English or French. Previous recipients are not eligible to re-apply.

name: Art Museum at the University of Toronto Award
description: These awards are intended to assist students who have been involved with the Art Museum at the University of Toronto. Students must demonstrate financial need in order to be eligible. Graduate and undergraduate students are eligible with preference to students who have some affiliation with University College.

name: Art Museum OSEFT II Awards
description: These awards are intended to assist students who have been involved with the University Art Centre in a significant way. Students must demonstrate financial need to be eligible. Graduate and undergraduate students from all colleges are eligible, preference to students who have some affiliation with University College. The Scholarship Committee will consult the Director of the Art Centre before selecting recipients.

name: Arts and Science Student Union Entrance Bursary UTAPS
description: This award is disbursed as part of the University of Toronto Financial Aid program. To be awarded to full-time, first-year Faculty of Arts and Science undergraduate students at the University of Toronto on the basis of financial need.

name: Atkinson Senior Undergraduate Bursary Fund UTAPS
description: This award is disbursed as part of the University of Toronto Financial Aid program. To be awarded to students in the third or fourth year of their programs of study on the basis of demonstrated financial need. The recipients would be expected to have maintained good academic standing.

name: Avie Bennett University of Toronto Grant UTAPS
description: To be awarded to students on the basis of financial need as part of the University of Toronto Financial Aid program.

name: Bader International Bursary
description: Awarded to students to enable them to participate in the International Studies Program at Herstmonceux, England, for University of Toronto degree credit. Preference is given to students registered at Victoria College. Students of other colleges in the Faculty of Arts and Science may also apply.

name: Barbara Mary Hardy Bursary
description: Awarded to Victoria College students with demonstrated financial need.

name: Beata Fitzpatrick Award
description: The Beata Fitzpatrick Award is intended for U of T administrative staff pursuing studies towards an undergraduate or graduate degree, on the basis of financial need. Recipients must be eligible for U of T staff tuition waiver.

name: Beatrice Bott Dow Bursary in English Literature
description: Established in memory of Beatrice Bott Dow by her family. To be awarded to a University College student enrolled in English Literature who has demonstrated financial need.

name: Bennett Scholars UTAPS
description: This award is disbursed as part of the University of Toronto Financial Aid program. To be awarded to full-time undergraduate students at the University of Toronto on the basis of financial need. The higher value awards will be given to students with Indigenous backgrounds or whose parents did not attend university or college. The remaining awards will be given to undergraduate students on the basis of financial need.

name: Bernice Gerhart Nursing Award UTAPS
description: This award is disbursed as part of the University of Toronto Financial Aid program. To be awarded to full-time undergraduate students at the University of Toronto on the basis of financial need in the Faculty of Nursing.

name: Rhodes Scholarship
description: The Rhodes Scholarship supports exceptional young people for postgraduate study at the University of Oxford, and actively fosters lifelong learning and fellowship. The Rhodes Scholarships are managed by the Rhodes Trust.
value: Covers Oxford University fees plus annual stipend
category: Academic Merit, Athletic Performance, Community, Financial Need, Leadership, Extra Curriculars

name: Susan J Serena Scholarship
description: Awarded to one or more students in the Faculty of Arts and Science who are well-rounded and demonstrate admirable qualities such as community service or involvement, or participation in athletics and sports, in addition to maintaining an academic average of at least a B-.
category: Academic Merit, Community, Athletic Performance, Extra Curriculars

name: Allen X. Ma Scholarship for Excellence in Leadership
description: Awarded to an international Rotman Commerce student with demonstrated community engagement and vision to impact the world.

name: Andy Zhuofan Chen Memorial Scholarship
description: Awarded to a Victoria College student who achieves excellence during the course of their studies, with preference to a student of Economics or Finance, who has made a positive contribution to the life of Victoria College and the community.
category: Academic Merit; Community; Other; Extra Curriculars

name: Bosco Law Award for Student Leadership in Anti-Racism and Inclusion
description: Provides recognition to students engaged in outstanding anti-racism efforts through demonstrated volunteerism, leadership and/or community involvement. Students must be registered in any undergraduate program in the Faculty of Arts and Science.
category: Academic Merit; Community; Leadership; Extra Curriculars

name: Cunningham Social Justice Award at Innis College
description: To be awarded to two undergraduate students entering first-year studies in Arts & Science at Innis College. The recipients will exemplify Frank Cunningham's values of social justice: socialism, democracy, equality and diversity. Financial need may be considered. The application for this award is typically available by mid-February, with an application deadline of mid-April.
category: Community; Financial Need; Leadership; Extra Curriculars

name: David H Farrar Undergraduate Scholarship in Chemistry
description: Awarded to an undergraduate student in the Department of Chemistry who distinguished him/herself both academically and for their leadership and contribution to the life of the University through student governance, community service or volunteer work.

name: Audrey Hozack Student Leadership Award
description: To be awarded to an undergraduate student with demonstrated leadership excellence within a Hart House group. Students may self-nominate or be nominated by Hart House staff.

name: Ben Chan Leadership Award
description: Awarded to Victoria College students in good academic standing with a minimum GPA of 3.0 who have shown active leadership in any aspect of student life, with preference for those participating in student government or student media.

name: John Grant Leadership Award
description: Awarded to Victoria College students who have obtained at least a B standing (GPA 3.0+) and who have made a positive contribution to the life of Victoria College and/or the broader community (preference given to students building community beyond student government).
category: Academic Merit; Community; Leadership; Extra Curriculars
